intro: Sanicula divaricata, commonly known as the slender sanicle, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Ranunculaceae, which includes many flowering plants with showy blooms. The plant features a basal rosette of leaves that are pinnately divided, giving it a delicate, fern-like appearance. Its flowers are small and yellowish-green, clustered in loose racemes, and it produces small, dry fruits known as achenes. Sanicula divaricata typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
